snippet: Magnus Carlsen, the new world champion, is only 23, but a group of teenagers is just waiting for a chance to take him on.
abstract: Dylan Loeb McClain Chess column notes that rising generation of young challengers are already hoping to strip Magnus Carlsen of his world championship, just one month after he won it.
lead_paragraph: Magnus Carlsen, the new world champion, is only 23, but a group of teenagers is just waiting for a chance to take him on.

headline.main: Young Rivals Already Hoping to End Champion’s Reign
headline.print_headline: Young Rivals Already Hoping To End Champion’s Reign
